en: You actually started the Day Fifty entry earlier today, got two paragraphs into it and tore those pages out and tossed them into the trash because your thoughts were too jumbled, your spelling too messy, you couldn’t figure out what you were trying to say because you were too upset.
zh: 其實你從今早的時候就開始寫第五十天的日記了，剛寫了兩段，你就把那一頁撕了下來，揉成一團扔進垃圾桶。你心煩意亂得很，拼寫潦草，弄不清楚自己究竟想寫些什麼，你只好撕掉那一頁，從頭開始寫，彷彿這樣做就可以當作那天的事情不存在。

en: If only it were so simple (yet in a way it is. If I don’t write it down, it will become easy for you to forget.
zh: （但在某種程度上，是的，如果我不寫下來，你很容易就會忘掉。

en: Not now, but when the Dark Tomorrow comes).
zh: 但並不是現在，而是當「黑暗的明天」降臨之時）。

en: You need the journal to help remember who you are, because this disease you’re pretending you don’t have, well, you have it.
zh: 你需要它，它可以幫助你記住自己是誰，你明明有病，卻假裝自己正常得很。

en: You can’t kid yourself anymore.
zh: 你別再騙自己了。

en: That’s Nicholas and Mandy for you. You do know that Mandy is looking out for your best interests. You know that.
zh: 這是尼古拉斯和曼蒂給你帶來的痛楚，但你知道曼蒂是在維護你的最佳利益，你知道的。

en: It just, well, it’s just the entire thing.
zh: 好吧，這就是整件事兒了。

en: You’ve let her down, and you’ve let yourself down.
zh: 你讓她失望了，也讓你自己失望了。

en: Mrs. Smith, on the other hand, is a different story.
zh: 史密斯太太則是另一道傷疤了。

en: Mrs. Smith isn’t just your neighbor, but also the mayor of Batshit County. She has her own Captain A steering her own ship.
zh: 她不只是你的鄰居，還是瘋人縣的縣長老大，「阿爾茨船長」正領航著她的生命之舟。

en: A while ago she complained about your garden (though good ol’ Hip-Hop Rick did spend a day in the yard a week ago, mowing and weeding and pruning and making things look nice before Sandra’s upcoming surprise birthday party), and now she seems to think you tore the roses out of her garden, but come on, you’re a forty-nine-yearold crime writer who has better things to drink than rip out her damn roses.
zh: 前一陣子，她跑過來抱怨你不打理花園（一個星期前，嘻哈瑞克用了一整天時間除草、修剪，想在桑德拉的驚喜生日派對之前把花園打理得漂漂亮亮的），結果她認定是你毀掉了她花園裡的玫瑰花。快拉倒吧，你是一位四十九歲的犯罪小說家，有那閑工夫還不如喝上一杯酒，你才懶得去剪她那糟心的玫瑰花呢。

en: Ha—not drink. Do. Better things to do.
zh: 哈，不喝酒，還有更要緊的事情要做。

en: Yesterday, however, the police got involved, and now Sandra is angry because she took You Know
zh: 昨天警方已經介入了，現在桑德拉進退兩難，她也不知道該站在哪一邊。

en: Basically here’s what happened—yesterday you all woke up to see the word CUNT had been spray-painted onto the front wall of Mrs. Smith’s house, the C on the front wall, the U covering the width of the door, the N on the wall next to that, and the T on the window.
zh: 基本上這件事是這樣的：昨天大家醒來后，都看到史密斯太太家的前牆上被油漆噴上了「盪|婦淫|娃」四個字，「盪」在前牆上，「婦」在門上，「淫」在旁邊的牆上，「娃」在窗上。

en: Nobody saw anything happen because it probably happened at night, and Mrs. Smith didn’t hear a thing because years of nagging her husband to death have perforated her eardrums.
zh: 沒有人看到是誰寫的，因為可能是晚上做的，史密斯太太什麼也沒有聽到。多年來，她對丈夫無休無止地嘮嘮叨叨，活生生把她丈夫給煩死了，這件事也導致她耳膜穿孔。

en: Naturally she came over and banged on your door.
zh: 她走了過來，「砰砰砰」地拍你的門。她當然會來拍的。

en: Somebody spray-painted the word asshole on your door?
zh: 有人在你的門上用油漆噴了「屁|眼」兩個字？

en: Go see Jerry.
zh: 去找傑瑞。

en: Fucktard on your letterbox?
zh: 有人在你的信箱上噴了「雜種」？

en: Go see Jerry.
zh: 去找傑瑞。

en: Go see Jerry.
zh: 去找傑瑞。

en: So she came and saw Jerry while Sandra was at work, and Jerry told her he had no idea what in the hell she was talking about, and she pointed out that Jerry had the same goddamn color spray-paint on his fingers, which Jerry pointed out wasn’t paint, but ink, because he’d written one hundred and ten goddamn names on one hundred and ten goddamn place cards the previous night for the wedding, and he’d been using a felt, so stop accusing him of spray-painting on her wall when, obviously, she was a cunt and everybody in the street knew it, giving everybody in the street a motive.
zh: 果真，她就趁著桑德拉去工作的時候來找傑瑞了。傑瑞告訴她，他不知道她到底在說些什麼。她說傑瑞手指上留著與噴漆顏色一樣的漆印，傑瑞說這不是漆印，是墨跡，因為他在伊娃婚禮的前一天晚上在一百一十張該死的請柬上寫了一百一十個該死的名字。他是用簽字筆寫的，所以，請不要再編派他在她的牆上噴漆了。

en: Is it possible you did this without being aware of it?
zh: 「有沒有可能是你在無意識的時候做的呢？」

en: one of the officers asked.
zh: 一個警察問道。

en: No, you said.
zh: 你說。

en: And it wasn’t possible.
zh: 「不可能。」

en: They said they would talk to others in the neighborhood, and would get back to you.
zh: 他們說他們會去找其他鄰居談談，一會兒再來找你。

en: As soon as they were gone Sandra asked if you had done it. You said no.
zh: 他們離開以後，桑德拉問是不是你乾的，你說不是。

en: Are you sure?
zh: 「你確定？」

en: Of course I’m sure.
zh: 「當然，我敢肯定。」

en: What hiding place?
zh: 「什麼暗格？」

en: The one beneath the desk.
zh: 「桌子底下的。」

en: How the hell do you know about that?
zh: 「你是怎麼知道的？」

en: So you showed her. After all, you had nothing to hide. You hadn’t spray-painted Mrs. Smith’s house.
zh: 結果你領她去看了，何況你也沒有什麼好隱瞞的，你本來就沒有在史密斯太太的房子上噴漆。

en: You pushed the desk aside and got out the screwdriver and pried up the loose floorboard.
zh: 你推開桌子，拿出螺絲刀撬開鬆動的地板。

en: Want to take a guess as to what was under there?
zh: 想猜一下那下面有什麼？

en: Nothing.
zh: 什麼也沒有。

en: That’s right. Nothing.
zh: 這就對了，什麼也不會有的。

en: You found the spray can later that night.
zh: 就在那天晚上，你找到了噴漆。

en: It was where you hide the writing backups, next to the gin and the gun.
zh: 它就在你藏著書稿備份的暗室里，靜靜地擺在杜松子酒和槍的旁邊。

en: They drive to the hospital without any more barbecue conversation.
zh: 他們開車去醫院，一路上再沒有燒烤式的閑談了。

en: Mayor sits cradling his hand and Jerry stares out the window, his mind tense, his anger hot, his pain deep. His face is wet with tears.
zh: 梅厄坐在副駕駛座上抱著他的手，傑瑞凝視著窗外，憂慮而憤怒，痛徹心扉，臉上掛滿淚水。

en: Being told you’ve done something and having no memory is like being told black is white and up is down.
zh: 當有人告訴你你做了一件毫無記憶的事，就好像是告訴你黑白顛倒、上下倒置一般。

en: They’ve told him Sandra is dead, but she can’t be dead because he’d know it.
zh: 他們告訴傑瑞桑德拉死了，但她不會死的，他知道她不會死。

en: Even if he doesn’t remember killing her, he would at least sense her absence from the world. They have been married twenty-five years.
zh: 即使他不記得殺了她，但至少他肯定會感覺到她已經不在世上了，他們已經結婚二十五年了。

en: He can clearly remember his conversation with Eva last week on the beach.
zh: 他清楚地記得上個星期在沙灘上與伊娃的談話。

en: She said Sandra had left him.
zh: 她說桑德拉只是離開了他。

en: Things had gotten too difficult. Sandra wasn’t dead—the weight of Jerry’s sickness had been too much for her, and she had left rather than let it crush her.
zh: 想要弄清真相真是艱難困阻，桑德拉沒有死，肯定是傑瑞的疾病負擔太重，讓她吃不消，她不想被拖累，所以才離開了。

en: At the hospital Mayor gets out of the car and throws angry looks at Jerry as he makes his way inside, and Jerry guesses he can’t blame him.
zh: 到了醫院，梅厄下車邊朝裏面走去，邊回頭給傑瑞拋來一個憤怒的眼神。傑瑞心想不能怪他。

en: He walks with his hand held against his chest, protecting it as if it were a small bird.
zh: 梅厄走路時把手護在胸前，保護著它，彷彿它是一隻小鳥。

en: Then it’s just Jerry and Chris, and Jerry says nothing as they make the five-minute drive from the hospital to the police station parking lot.
zh: 現在就剩下傑瑞和克里斯了，從醫院到警局的停車場有五分鐘的車程，一路上傑瑞保持著沉默，什麼也沒說。

en: They take an elevator up to the fourth floor. It all looks vaguely familiar, and Jerry suspects he’s been here before, that at some point in his career he must have been curious enough about the police station to ask for a tour.
zh: 他們乘電梯到了四樓，這裏的一切看起來都很眼熟，傑瑞猜他以前來過這裏，在他的寫作生涯中，他也必然對警局充滿了好奇。

en: Write what you know, and fake the rest.
zh: 「寫你所熟悉的，其餘的可以虛構。」

en: He wonders how many books he faked this place in, then he remembers he was here last week, that it’s from here Eva came and picked him up.
zh: 他想知道他在多少本書里虛構了這個地方，上個星期他還來過這裏，伊娃就是從這裏把他接走的。

en: He’s led to an interrogation room. Chris undoes the handcuffs and Jerry starts massaging his wrists.
zh: 他被帶到了審訊室，克里斯打開手銬，傑瑞揉著手腕。

en: “You want something to drink?” Chris asks.
zh: 「你想喝點什麼？」克里斯問道。

en: “Sure thing, Jerry. I’ll bring you one right away.
zh: 「好的，傑瑞，我馬上給你拿來。

en: Would you like anything else?
zh: 你還需要什麼？

en: You want a small umbrella in it?”
zh: 裏面加點小虎耳草嗎？」

en: Jerry thinks about it. “Sure, if you’ve got them.”
zh: 傑瑞想了想：「當然好，如果你們有的話……」

en: Chris places the photograph of Belinda Murray on the table, then leaves the room.
zh: 克里斯把貝琳達·穆雷的照片放在桌上，然後離開了房間。

en: Jerry knows what’s going on—he’s put enough fictional people into this situation before to know they’ll let him sweat in here for a while, before hitting him with a round of good cop, bad cop.
zh: 傑瑞知道接下來將要發生什麼，他曾為許多書中人物設計過眼前的場景，他知道他們會讓他在這裏待上一會兒，出出汗，好警察和壞警察們將會輪番上場，給他以震懾。

en: Fifteen minutes later he’s still alone and sitting down.
zh: 十五分鐘后，審訊室里還是只有他一個人，他坐了下來。

en: Maybe they’re waiting for Mayor to have his fingers set. Maybe they’re going to wait for the bone to knit back together and for Easter to roll around.
zh: 也許他們在等著梅厄接上手指，等著手骨愈合，等著復活節來臨。

en: His lawyer hasn’t arrived. His gin and tonic hasn’t arrived.
zh: 他的律師還沒有來，加奎寧水的杜松子酒也沒有來。

en: He paces the room a few times then sits back down and stares at the photograph of a woman he’s never seen before until today, and he wonders why it is they think he killed her, and if she was involved with his daughter’s wedding then of course he wouldn’t know her—all that stuff was taken care of by Sandra and Eva.
zh: 他在房間里來回踱步，過了幾分鐘又坐了下來，凝視著女人的照片。在此以前，他從來沒有見過她，他知道他們非要認定是他殺害了她。就算她參加了他女兒的婚禮，他也不會認識她的，因為所有事情都是由桑德拉和伊娃共同打理的。

en: Then the door opens up and a man Jerry has never seen before comes in and sits opposite and says his name is Tim Anderson and that he’s his lawyer.
zh: 這時，門開了，一個傑瑞從來沒有見過的男人走了進來坐在對面，他說他的名字叫蒂姆·安德森，是他的律師。

en: They shake hands.
zh: 他們握了握手。

en: Tim is in his midfifties with silver hair slicked back on the sides and flattened on top.
zh: 蒂姆五十五歲左右，古銅色皮膚，一頭銀髮向後梳著。

en: He’s wearing glasses that make his eyes look smaller, like looking backwards though a pair of binoculars, and has a summer tan even though it’s spring, which means it’s either paid for or he’s just back from an overseas holiday.
zh: 他戴著一副眼鏡，眼睛像是躲在望遠鏡的後面，顯得更小了。他戴著一頂太陽帽，如同剛從國外度假回來。

en: He has a nice suit and a nice watch, and Jerry figures that means he gets paid well, and that probably means he’s good at his job.
zh: 他穿著一件做工考究的西裝，手腕上戴著名貴的手錶。傑瑞心想，這意味著他待遇優厚，從而反映出他業務精湛。

en: “I am your usual lawyer,” he says.
zh: 「我就是你的律師。」

en: “That answers my question as to whether you recognize me.”
zh: 他說，「回答我的問題，你認不認識我？」

en: Jerry shrugs. “Don’t take it personally.”
zh: 傑瑞聳聳肩：「別往心裏去。」

en: Tim puts the pad on the table. He puts a pen next to it. Then he puts the briefcase on the floor and interlocks his fingers and leans his elbows on the desk and his chin on his knuckles. “I’ve been your lawyer for fifteen years.”
zh: 蒂姆把筆記本攤在桌上，旁邊放了一支筆，接著把公文包放在地板上，雙肘頂在桌上交叉起手指，托著下巴：「我做你的律師已經十五年了。」

en: “I’m sorry,” Jerry says, shaking his head a little.
zh: 「對不起。」傑瑞說，微微搖搖頭，「我不知道我為什麼會在這裏。」

en: “That’s why I’m here, Jerry, to get things cleared up,” Tim says, and he shifts the pad a little closer and picks up the pen.
zh: 「這就是我來到這裏的原因，傑瑞，為了把事情澄清。」蒂姆說著，把筆記本向前挪了挪，拿起筆，「告訴我你能記住的一切，從你眼睛下面的腫塊開始說起。

en: Who hit you?”
zh: 是誰打的你？」

en: Jerry tells him everything he can about the two policemen, how they think he killed the girl in the photograph. He tells him about the car ride, getting handcuffed and punched along the way.
zh: 傑瑞告訴了他那兩個警察對他所做的一切，他說他們認定是他殺了照片中的女孩，讓他上了車，銬上手銬，在路上被毆打。

en: He tells him they’re trying to convince him Sandra is dead, and then stares silently at the lawyer, waiting for a confirmation he doesn’t want, and that confirmation comes in the way his lawyer drops his pen, sighs, and looks down at his hands for a few seconds.
zh: 他說他們想讓他相信桑德拉已經死了，隨後默默地盯著律師，等著他最不希望聽到的答案。律師放下筆，嘆了口氣，低頭看著自己的手，過了幾秒鐘后他說：「傑瑞，恐怕這是真的。

en: Did they tell you how?”
zh: 他們告訴你過程了嗎？」

en: Tim carries on. “She was shot. You . . .
zh: 蒂姆接著說：「她被人一槍打死了。

en: you didn’t know what you were doing,” he says.
zh: 你……你不知道自己做了什麼。

en: “It’s why you’re in a nursing home and not in jail.
zh: 這就是你為什麼會在療養院，而不是在監獄。

en: It was an awful, awful thing, and nobody is to blame.”
zh: 對於這件可怕至極的事情，我們卻無法責怪任何人。」

en: Jerry thinks that’s a stupid thing to say. Nobody to blame?
zh: 傑瑞認為這是個愚蠢的說法：無法責怪任何人？

en: So what, the gun just magically appeared in the house, just magically pointed itself at Sandra and went off?
zh: 槍奇迹般地出現在了家裡，奇迹般地瞄準了桑德拉並且開火？

en: He knows who is to blame. It was Captain A.
zh: 他知道這是誰的錯：「阿爾茨船長」。

en: These people have known about Sandra’s death for a year, but for him the news is fresh. For him she’s only been dead half an hour.
zh: 於他們而言，桑德拉去世已經是一年前的舊事了，但對他來說卻是新聞，桑德拉剛剛去世了一個半小時。

en: He puts his hands over his face and cries into them. The world goes dark.
zh: 他雙手捂住了臉，整個世界驟然漆黑一片，他嗚嗚地哭了起來。

en: He thinks about Sandra, the good times, and there are no bad times—there never were. All those smiles, all the times they’ve laughed, made love, held hands. His chest feels tight.
zh: 他回憶著桑德拉，回憶著沒有糟心事的甜美時光，充斥著歡聲笑語、床笫之樂。

en: The world without Sandra is a world he doesn’t want to be in.
zh: 他胸腔里陣陣發緊。他不想待在沒有桑德拉的世界，他不知道沒有了她他該怎麼活下去。

en: That was forgetting. He pushes away from the table and throws up on the floor, the vomit splashing and hitting his shoes.
zh: 他猛地推開桌子，衝著地板一陣嘔吐，穢物亂濺，弄到他的鞋上了。

en: His lawyer stays where he is, probably figuring he can’t charge any more than he already is so there’s no point in patting Jerry on the back and telling him everything is going to be okay. No point in risking getting anything gooey on his suit.
zh: 他的律師仍舊一動不動，大概是盤算著他反正又不能收取額外費用了，所以還是別冒著弄髒西裝的風險去拍拍傑瑞的背然後告訴他一切都會好的。

en: When Jerry’s done he wipes his arm over his mouth and straightens back up.
zh: 傑瑞吐完后，用胳膊抹了抹嘴，直起身來。

en: “I’m sorry about Sandra, I really am, and I’m sorry about what happened to you, but we have to talk about today.
zh: 蒂姆說，「我對桑德拉的事表示遺憾，對發生在你身上的事表示遺憾，但我們今天不說這個。

en: We have to talk about Belinda Murray. Go over again everything that happened today,” he says, and he picks the pen back up and positions it over the notepad.
zh: 我們得說說貝琳達·穆雷，再核對一下今天發生的一切。」

en: Jerry shakes his head. The smell of vomit is strong. “First tell me about Sandra.”
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭，嘔吐物的氣味很濃：「先告訴我桑德拉的事。」

en: “I’m not so sure that’s going to be helpful.”
zh: 「我不知道這是否有用。」

en: “Please.”
zh: 「求求你了。」

en: Tim puts the pen back down and leans back.
zh: 蒂姆放下筆，靠在椅子上。

en: “We don’t know, not exactly.
zh: 「我也不是很清楚。

en: Do you remember the wedding?”
zh: 你還記得婚禮嗎？」

en: “No. I mean . . .
zh: 「不記得了。我是說……記得。」

en: yes,” he says, and the wedding he can remember, but not what happened to Sandra.
zh: 他說。婚禮他能記得，但不記得桑德拉發生了什麼事。

en: He ruined the wedding.
zh: 他摧毀了整場婚禮。

en: “Is that why I killed her?
zh: 「這就是為什麼我殺了她？

en: Because of that?”
zh: 因為婚禮？」

en: “Nobody knows.
zh: 「沒人知道。

en: The disease was progressing quickly by that point. By the time the alarms were installed all through the house, you—”
zh: 那時，你身上的癥狀加重得很快，屋子裡到處安裝著警報器，你——」

en: “What alarms?”
zh: 「什麼警報器？」

en: “Sometimes you would wander,” he says.
zh: 「有時候你會出去遊盪。」

en: “Sandra hid your car keys so at least you couldn’t drive, but you would sneak out of the house and you would disappear, so she had to get them in.”
zh: 他說，「桑德拉把你的車鑰匙藏了起來，至少你就不能開車了。但你還是會偷偷溜出家門，消失得無影無蹤，所以她只能安裝警報器。」

en: “Really?
zh: 「真的？

en: I would sneak out?”
zh: 我會偷偷溜出去？」

en: “The alarms were for your protection.
zh: 「安裝警報器是為了保護你。

en: If you tried to leave, she had a bracelet that would notify her.
zh: 如果你想離開，她的手鐲就會通知她。

en: If Sandra went out, she would take you with her, or she would call somebody to come over.
zh: 桑德拉外出的時候也會帶著你，或者她會叫別人過來。

en: By then she was taking time off work to look after you. You didn’t like how it made you feel.”
zh: 那時她請假全天照顧你，不過你並不喜歡那種感覺。」

en: “I would have felt babied,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我會覺得自己像個嬰兒。」傑瑞說。

en: “The problem is you used to sneak out the window.
zh: 「問題在於你還會常常翻窗外出。

en: Alarms were going to be put on those too after Sandra found out, but then . . .
zh: 桑德拉發現后，計劃著在那兒也安裝警報器，但之後……

en: well, they were scheduled to go in the same day she died.
zh: 嗯，原計劃安裝警報器的那一天，她死了。

en: The problem now, Jerry, is that it shows a pattern of escape. The police are going to think that you killed this woman, then killed Sandra because she figured it out.”
zh: 問題在於那兒有逃跑的痕迹，所以警方認為你殺了這個女人，因為她發現了。」

en: “I . . . I couldn’t have done it. Any of it.”
zh: 「我……我不可能做這件事的，任何事都不會做。」

en: “The police don’t know exactly what happened. They didn’t even find the gun.
zh: 「但警察並不知道到底發生了什麼，他們甚至沒有找到槍。

en: You were tested for gunshot residue and none was found, but you showered several times over the days between her death and you calling the police.”
zh: 他們對你進行了搜查，尋找槍擊殘留物，但一無所獲。但那些天你洗了好幾次澡，是你報的警。」

en: “How long?”
zh: 「多長時間？」

en: “Four days,” he says.
zh: 「四天。」

en: “Because your office was soundproofed, nobody heard the gunshot.
zh: 他說，「因為你的辦公室裝有隔音設備，所以沒有人聽到槍聲。

en: If there was blood splatter on your shirt, it was hidden by the fact you sat in your wife’s blood for considerable stretches of time, holding her.
zh: 比如你襯衫上沾上了血跡，但也有可能是你坐在妻子的血泊里抱著她，待了很長一段時間。

en: When you did call the police, you confessed.
zh: 你打電話報警，承認了一切。

en: We don’t know why you shot Sandra, Jerry, we just know that you did.”
zh: 我們不知道你為什麼要開槍打死桑德拉，傑瑞，我們只知道你開槍打死了她。」

en: Jerry wonders how many times over the last year this news has been broken to him, then he thinks of Eva telling him that Sandra left and was filing for divorce, not wanting to tell him the truth, wanting to spare him unnecessary pain.
zh: 傑瑞想知道，在過去的一年中，有多少人向他隱瞞了這件事。他想起伊娃告訴過他桑德拉只是走了，提出離婚而已，她不想告訴他真相，免得讓他產生不必要的痛苦。

en: It hits him then as to why his daughter calls him Jerry, and not Dad.
zh: 他突然想明白了，女兒為什麼叫他「傑瑞」而不叫「爸爸」。

en: Not because he messed up the wedding, but because he killed her mother.
zh: 不是因為他搞砸了她的婚禮，而是因為他殺了她的母親。

en: He imagines sitting on the floor of his office, a smoking gun in one hand, holding his dead wife in the other.
zh: 他想象著這樣的場景：他坐在寫作房的地板上，一手拿著冒著煙的槍，另一隻手臂抱著妻子的屍體，他想象著，就像他在紙頁上虛構著的人物死亡的場景。

en: “The doctors believe you’ve repressed the memory because it’s too traumatic for you.
zh: 「為什麼我不記得殺死了她？」「醫生認為你抑制住了記憶，因為那太痛苦了，只會給你造成心理上的創傷。

en: Your doctor thinks you just may never remember it.
zh: 你的醫生認為你可能永遠都不會記起這件事來。

en: I’m sorry, Jerry, I really am, and I don’t want this to sound awful, but we really need to focus on why we’re here.
zh: 真的很對不起，傑瑞，我不想把這件事講得如此痛心疾首。但我們現在就在這裏，我們必須先解決眼下的事。

en: Tell me what you told the police.”
zh: 告訴我，你都對警察說了些什麼？」

en: Jerry buries his face in his arms as he thinks about Sandra, and if it’s true, if he did hurt her, then what does anything else matter?
zh: 傑瑞趴在手臂上，心裏滿是桑德拉。要是這是真的，要是他真的殺害了她，還有什麼事算得上重要呢？

en: He should pick up the lawyer’s pen and, if the door is unlocked, run among the desks threatening to stab somebody until they put him down and end this nightmare.
zh: 如果門沒有鎖，他應該拿起律師的筆跑到外面，揚言威脅要刺死什麼人，這樣他們就能把他打倒在地，結束這場噩夢。

en: “Jerry, come on, we need to work on this, okay?
zh: 「來吧傑瑞，我們需要把這事辦完，好嗎？

en: I’m sorry about Sandra, but now we need to concentrate on you.
zh: 我對桑德拉的遭遇深表遺憾，但現在我們需要集中精力辦你的事。

en: You need to work with me if we’re to get you out of here.”
zh: 如果你想從這兒出去，就需要配合我的工作。」

en: “I don’t care if I get out,” Jerry says, talking into the table.
zh: 「我不在乎能不能出去。」傑瑞趴在那裡說。

en: “Well you should, because if you didn’t kill this girl, and the police believe you did, then the real killer is going to get away with it.
zh: 「你應該在乎的。因為如果你沒有殺害這個女孩，而警方認定是你乾的，那麼真正的兇手就會逍遙法外。

en: Is that what you want?”
zh: 你希望這樣嗎？」

en: Jerry looks back up at him. He hadn’t thought of that.
zh: 傑瑞抬起頭看了看他，這一點他倒沒有想到。

en: “Wait here a minute,” Tim says, and he steps out of the room.
zh: 「稍等一下。」蒂姆走出了房間，三十秒后他回來了，帶回一個門警。

en: The janitor brings in a mop and bucket and takes care of the mess, and a minute later Jerry is alone again with his lawyer and the room smells a little better.
zh: 一分鐘后，這裏就又只剩下傑瑞和他的律師了，房間里的味道好聞了一些。

en: “Tell me everything,” Tim says.
zh: 「告訴我所有的事吧。」蒂姆說。

en: “Okay, okay.
zh: 「好吧，

en: Let me think,” Jerry says, and he takes a few deep breaths and he tries to push thoughts of Sandra aside and focus on today.
zh: 好吧，讓我想想。」傑瑞說。他做了幾次深呼吸，想先把桑德拉的事放在一邊，專心致志地想今天的事。

en: He doesn’t think anything in his story changes, but how can he possibly know?
zh: 他不認為自己的故事有過什麼改變，但他怎麼知道呢？

en: He’s the man who can’t even trust himself.
zh: 他是個連自己都無法信任的人啊。

en: He starts talking. Tim takes notes along the way.
zh: 他說了起來，蒂姆則一直在做筆記。

en: When Jerry’s done, Tim says, “I spoke to Nurse Hamilton before I came in. She says it’s common for you to get confused between reality and fiction.
zh: 傑瑞說完后，蒂姆說：「來之前我跟漢密爾頓護士談過，她說，這很常見，你把現實和小說弄混淆了。

en: She says there are days where you think things in your books are real and you’ve done them.
zh: 她說有時你認為書中的事情是真的，覺得你做了那些事。

en: She says you sometimes confess to killing your neighbor when you were at university.
zh: 你有時承認上大學時殺死了鄰居。

en: She says you were so adamant about it that they looked through old news reports and they spoke to Eva about it, but it just didn’t happen.”
zh: 她說你實在是太固執了，他們翻看過以前的新聞報道，也和伊娃談論過，結果證明什麼都沒有發生過。」

en: “I remember her,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我記得她。」傑瑞說，「蘇姍。」

en: “She doesn’t exist, Jerry.”
zh: 「她根本不存在，傑瑞。」

en: “I know. I mean I remember her in the books.”
zh: 「我知道，我是說我記得在書中寫過她。」

en: “And Belinda Murray?
zh: 「那貝琳達·穆雷呢？

en: Do you remember her too?”
zh: 你還記得她嗎？」

en: Jerry takes another look at Belinda Murray, but no matter how hard he tries, he can’t picture her in any context other than this photograph. She seems far less real than Suzan.
zh: 傑瑞又看了一眼貝琳達·穆雷的照片，但除了這張照片，他無論如何都想不出其他什麼了，遠不如蘇姍真實。

en: “I don’t know. I don’t think so.
zh: 「我不知道，我真的不知道。

en: Do the police have any evidence I hurt her?” he asks.
zh: 警方有我傷害她的證據嗎？」

en: Tim shakes his head. “Doubtful.
zh: 蒂姆搖搖頭：「這一點很可疑。

en: They already have your prints and DNA after Sandra’s death.
zh: 桑德拉去世以後，他們已經提取了你的指紋和DNA。

en: If there’d been a match in the system it would have come up eleven months ago.
zh: 如果在系統中比對成功，他們早在十一個月前就該找你了。

en: Could be your confession is the only lead they’ve had, that they weren’t able to get anything from the scene.”
zh: 可能你的口供是他們唯一的線索，他們沒有在現場發現任何東西。」

en: Jerry thinks about that. He remembers Mayor asking him in the car if he thought he could outsmart the police, whether crime writers thought they could get away with murder.
zh: 傑瑞回想著，他記得梅厄在汽車上問過他，他會不會比警察更聰明，因為犯罪小說家可以認為殺人之後繼續逍遙法外。

en: “I didn’t do it. That’s why they’re not finding any evidence of me at the scene.”
zh: 「我沒有做過，這就是為什麼他們在現場沒有發現任何證據。」

en: “You mean other than killing Sandra?”
zh: 「以前有沒有發生過這種事，比如你做過什麼，而自己卻忘了的？」「你的意思是說除了殺死桑德拉的其他事？」

en: “There was a report last year of your neighbor having an obscenity spray-painted across the front of her house.
zh: 「去年你的鄰居報案說，她家的前牆上出現了淫穢字跡的噴漆。

en: Do you remember that?”
zh: 你還記得嗎？」

en: “What neighbor?”
zh: 「什麼鄰居？」

en: “Mrs. Smith.”
zh: 「史密斯太太。」

en: Jerry shakes his head.
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭。

en: He can remember the neighbor, but not what Tim is talking about.
zh: 他記得這個鄰居，但不知道蒂姆在說什麼。

en: “I remember somebody pulled her flowers out.”
zh: 「我記得有人把她的花拔掉了。」

en: “I don’t know anything about that,” Tim says, “but she believes you were the one who spray-painted her house.”
zh: 「這個我不知道。」蒂姆說，「但她認為是你在她房子上噴漆。」

en: “Then she was wrong.”
zh: 「她搞錯了。」

en: “There’s another report from four days later. Mrs. Smith’s car was set on fire.
zh: 「四天後又有人報案，史密斯太太的車被人縱火燒毀了。

en: You don’t remember that?”
zh: 你不記得了嗎？」

en: He thinks back, but there’s nothing there—no neighbor, no car, no fire.
zh: 他努力回想著，但什麼印象也沒有，沒有鄰居，沒有車，沒有火。

en: “No.”
zh: 「不記得了。」

en: Tim taps the pen against the table. “Okay, here’s the way I see it.
zh: 蒂姆用筆敲敲桌子：「好吧，我知道了。

en: Do you watch the news?”
zh: 你看新聞嗎？」

en: “Sometimes.”
zh: 「有時看。」

en: “And read the newspapers?”
zh: 「看報紙嗎？」

en: “Sometimes.”
zh: 「有時看。」

en: “Good.
zh: 「好的。

en: We’re going to get the detectives back in here now and we’re going to tell them what we think is going on.”
zh: 咱們現在讓警察回來，告訴他們我們的想法是什麼。」

en: “Which is?”
zh: 「是什麼？」

en: “Which is not only do you confuse your books with the real world, but also news reports too.
zh: 「你不僅把書中情節和現實世界弄混淆了，還把新聞報道混淆了。

en: You can’t switch it off. We’re going to tell the police you have confused the news story with your own reality the same way you confuse your fiction with your reality.
zh: 我們要告訴警察你把新聞報道和現實世界弄混淆了，而且還把小說情節與現實世界弄混淆了。

en: We’re not going to answer any questions because you have no memory of the event and can’t help with any answers, and any questions they ask at this point may only end up having you confess to a reality that never happened.
zh: 不要回答任何你沒有印象的問題，回答了也沒有用，他們在這個節點上提問，其目的就在於逼供，強迫你承認沒有發生過的事情。只要這麼做，我們就可以幫你離開這裏回家。」

en: “Back home or back to the nursing home?”
zh: 「回家還是回療養院？」

en: “To the nursing home.”
zh: 「回療養院。」

en: He taps the photograph. “I didn’t hurt her.”
zh: 傑瑞拍了拍照片：「我沒有傷害她。」

en: Tim puts his pen and his pad back into his briefcase. “Wait here for me, Jerry, I’m going to go and talk to the detectives alone.
zh: 蒂姆把鋼筆和筆記本放回公文包：「在這裏等我，傑瑞，我要去跟警察單獨談談。

en: I’ll be back shortly.”
zh: 我很快就會回來。」

en: “They were going to bring me a gin and tonic,” Jerry says.
zh: 「他們要給我拿加奎寧水的杜松子酒。」傑瑞說。

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “The detective asked if I wanted a drink. He said he’d get me one right away.”
zh: 「偵探問我要不要喝點什麼，他說他會馬上給我拿來的。」

en: “Okay, Jerry.
zh: 「好吧，傑瑞。

en: Wait here and let me see what I can do,” he says, and then he slips out the door and once again Jerry is left waiting in the interrogation room, thirsty and all alone.
zh: 在這兒等著，我看看我能做些什麼。」他出了門，留下傑瑞獨自在審訊室里口渴難耐地等候著。
